definition: Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]

sentences.english: “You don’t have to drop them off, ” Madeleine said, undeterred.
sentences.chinese: “你不用交給別人去洗，”瑪德琳毫不退縮地說。

sentences.english: Madeleine placed it carefully in the rocky niche.
sentences.chinese: 瑪德琳小心翼翼地把它放在岩石壁龕裏。

sentences.english: Madeline woke up two hours later.
sentences.chinese: 兩個小時以後，瑪德琳醒來了。

sentences.english: Madeleine vanished from a hotel room in Portugal.
sentences.chinese: 瑪德琳是從葡萄牙的一家旅店客房裏失蹤的。

sentences.english: Madeleine thought the handwriting looked feminine.
sentences.chinese: 瑪德琳認爲那筆跡出自女人之手。

sentences.english: Madeleine dog-eared the page she was reading.
sentences.chinese: 瑪德琳把她正在讀的那頁書折了一角。

sentences.english: It was then that Madeleine threw the book at his head.
sentences.chinese: 就在此時，瑪德琳瞄準他的腦袋把書扔了過去。

sentences.english: Madeleine ran a finger along her lower lip.
sentences.chinese: 瑪德琳用一隻手指來回抹着自己的下嘴脣。

sentences.english: Madeline Morris has this report from Washington.
sentences.chinese: 瑪德琳莫里斯從華盛頓發揮報道。

sentences.english: Madeleines are very small sponge cakes with a distinctive shell-like shape.
sentences.chinese: 瑪德琳蛋糕形狀小巧，就像貝殼一樣。
